def.dt: :a seed that is eaten as a vegetable and that comes from any one of many different kinds of climbing plants We ate rice and beans for dinner.
:a part of a plant that contains very young seeds and that is eaten as a vegetable see also green bean pole bean snap bean string bean wax bean
:a plant that produces beans We're growing tomatoes and beans in our garden this year.
:a seed that looks like a bean but that does not come from a climbing plant coffee beans cocoa beans a vanilla bean see also jelly bean jumping bean
:full of energy and life We were young and full of beans. Although she's much older now, she's still full of beans.
:not correct or truthful :full of nonsense If that's what he's been saying, then he's full of beans.
:to not know anything about (something) He doesn't know beans about computers. [=he knows nothing about computers]
:to reveal secret information I tried to get him to tell me what he knew, but he refused to spill the beans.

:to hit (someone) on the head with something A kid in the back of the room beaned me with an eraser. [=threw an eraser that hit my head] (baseball) The pitcher almost beaned the first batter. [=he threw a pitch that almost hit the batter's head]
:a person who helps to run a business and who only cares about money He blames corporate bean counters for causing thousands of workers to lose their jobs.
:very young plants that come from bean seeds and that are used as a vegetable
:a kind of small, flat bean :a small lima bean
:a lima bean that is dried before it is sold
:the seed of a tropical tree (called the cacao) that is used in making cocoa, chocolate, and cocoa butter
:the bean of a tropical tree or bush from which coffee is made
:a large, flat, pale green seed that is eaten as a vegetable called also (chiefly Brit) broad bean
